step1.sentence: I always get butterflies in my stomach right before a job interview.

step2.story: Maya stood backstage, clutching her guitar. She had butterflies in her stomach as the announcer called her name. She took a deep breath and walked into the spotlight.

step3.story: Daniel checked his reflection in the elevator mirror for the third time. Today was the day he would present his startup idea to a room full of investors. He had butterflies in his stomach the entire morning, barely able to eat breakfast. As he stepped into the conference room, he noticed his hands were trembling slightly. But the moment he clicked to his first slide and saw the audience lean in with curiosity, the nervousness melted away. By the end, he was smiling — the butterflies had turned into pure adrenaline.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 배 속에 나비가 있다는 뜻으로, 긴장이나 설렘으로 속이 울렁거리는 느낌을 비유한 표현입니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 중요한 발표, 면접, 첫 데이트 등 긴장되거나 설레는 상황에서 느끼는 불안한 떨림을 표현할 때 사용합니다. 부정적인 공포보다는 기대감이 섞인 긴장감에 더 가깝습니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 1900년대 초반부터 사용된 표현으로, 긴장할 때 위장이 수축하면서 느끼는 떨리는 감각이 마치 나비가 배 속에서 날아다니는 것 같다는 데서 유래했습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 일상적이고 친근한 표현으로, 격식 없는 대화에서 자주 쓰입니다. 심각한 공포가 아닌 가벼운 긴장이나 설렘의 뉘앙스를 담고 있습니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: She had butterflies in her stomach before her first date.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그녀는 첫 데이트 전에 긴장으로 속이 울렁거렸다.
